title: Old School Delicious
text: If you are looking for a special occasion or date night, this is a great place. The service is impeccable as is every dish they serve. I've also visited Al Beirnat's for Restaurant Week and was blown away by their menu.

title: Favorite!
text:
This is our new obsession. We've been going here weekly for over a year now. The chef offers a fresh taste of Mexican food in an upscale, beautifully decorated environment. The staff's service is beyond amazing. They are all super attentive. I love how they change the menu seasonally. Margaritas are great-not too sweet, and they have a great mezcal menu as well. There is nothing I don't like about this place.

Great for romantic, business, or special occasion dinners.

title: Artistic!
text: The food here is amazing. GF & vegan dietary restrictions can be accommodated. On top of everything being delicious, it is well presented and artistically plated. The wine menu is decent and I really loved being able to stroll the onsite garden and have the chef tell us about how they grow everything themselves or source it as locally as possible

title: Absolutely Incredible!
text: First off, make sure you have cash. They only accept cash. Their menu is amazing. Their drinks are well balanced and delicious, and their staff is well versed on their menu and dietary restrictions. Get a table along the ocean at sunset. The view is breathtaking. We spent the afternoon on the beach then walked right up to the restaurant.

title: Wonderful for Family Adventure
text: We took our 8 yr old daughter here a long time ago and it was a wonderful experience. We snorkeled through underground caves. Saw animals, and donned rain ponchos to splash around the entire park for the day. Kids will love this!
place: Priority Access: Xcaret Day Trip with Transportation

title: Great Site!
text: You are able to tour the ruins on your own. You don't have to get any of the tour guides at the entrance to help you. I do recommend paying for a tuk-tuk driver to drive you up to the ruins and back. Saves you a lot of energy once you have climbed the ruins.

title: Pool Are is Nice
text: We only hung out at the pool area and had cocktails and small bites. The prices were GREAT! The pool is nice and their sound system was incredible!! We had margaritas and beer and drank them while sitting on swings at the bar.

title: Excellent Food!
text: The food here is so good. We went back several times. Big portion, well balanced flavors, excellent menu, and their cocktails are delicious. GF and vegan options were easy here.

title: Great Brunch. Dinner was "ok"
text: They have an amazing mezcal margarita that we kept going back for. Their brunch was absolutely beautiful and accommodated GF and vegan dietary restrictions in our group. We went back for dinner and it was just ok.

title: Great Tour
text: I loved the small group of 10 people we had for this tour. Our guide made the experience memorable. He kept us all together and was super knowledgeable. I also liked how he was concerned about our safety walking around the ruins.
place: Skip the Line Acropolis of Athens Tour

title: Excellent Wine & Food
text: We kept going back to this wine bar. The owners could not have been sweeter. I loved how to set up their flights menu by area. All their wines are Greek. Their food is amazing. I will always go back to Cinque.

title: Quaint
text: This is the shopping area and it is much bigger than you think! What I loved about the Plaka is you are able to meander and stop for bites and wine, then meander again.

title: Take A Tour
text: I would suggest you do this one with a small tour group. You will get so much more out of hearing the history of the area.

title: Breathtaking
text: Wear comfortable shoes and be careful not to slip on the marble. You will walk up some steep hills but it is worth the effort.

title: Beautiful !
text:
We visited this museum at night. It is not large, but you can spend hours taking in the history of each piece.

Dine on the patio in the evening under the Parthenon. You don't want to miss this view.

title: There's Not Enough Stars in the Rating System for this Place
text:
This is probably the best meal I have ever had. We ordered to full menu with the complete wine pairing. Everything was incredible and presented elegantly. I loved how our server explained where everything was from. Our service could not have been better.

If you are a foodie, you need to experience Spondi. Plan to dine for the whole evening.

title: Great Selection
text: You can get any wine by the glass here which was a treat. The Greek wines are wonderful as is their service. Definitely going back.

title: Great Spot
text: We stopped in for small bites and cocktails and we were not disappointed. I was I,pressed by the quality of the food and the martinis were perfect. I was also impressed by how they have their sound angled inside. If you sit in the far back, you can have nice conversation. In the middle under the ceiling square is more difficult because that’s where the speakers face. Well done!

title: Meh
text: I don’t know why people are raving over this. The menu was sparse as was the drink menu. Food was mediocre at best. The view was lovely if you ignored the chaos below. I’m not a fan.

title: Favorite Starting Place
text: This is our favorite place to start our evening in the Quarter. Their staff is amazing and their drinks are stiff. We love their drag shows too.

title: Favorite Drink
text: My favorite drink is New Orleans is at R Bar. They make an amazing mezcal, jalapeno, cucumber drink that is refreshing and potent.

title: Favorite for Breakfast
text:
This is my favorite spot for breakfast. We have our morning process down. They open at 7am. We always arrive by 9:30am. If you arrive after that, you're going to have a LONG wait.

My husband is vegan and they have many options for him to piece together. He's always quite satisfied. My favorite dish is the Waffle Cochon. There is nothing mediocre on their menu and I love the corner location.

title: Wonderful Morning Excursion
text: We spent 5 week’s in Berlin and hit this place every Tuesday and Friday. It is big enough to have a lot of choices. But small enough to not overwhelmingly or waste the whole day. Check out the vegan donut place behind it.

title: Met Expectations
text: We ventured here by bike. I didn’t know what I was expecting, but I guess it met Expectations. It was a nice spot to take a break and rest while biking all morning, but other than that, I didn’t get much from the experience.

title: Wonderful Wines
text:
I was gifted a bottle of their champagne and was surprised when I found their tasting room in NM. I had to visit.

It is centrally located and easy to find. The staff was So nice. We were surprised to learned about all their still wines on offer. We ended up having a mixed case sent back home.

My,favorite is their brut. I serve it to all our friends.

title: Tasting Room was Great
text:
We had a wonderful experience in this tasting room. We were also the only ones ther, so we got a lot more attention than I’m sure we normally would.

We ended up joining their 2 bottle a month club.

Also, if you are looking for an off-grid experience, there is a yurt just down the road that added so much to this trip.

title: Excellent Food
text: We stop by here late at night on our way home from other places. We are hooked on their vegan streusels.

title: Our Favorite Coffee Shop
text:
We try to hit this place at least 3 times a week. My husband is vegan and it is a treat for him to not have to question anything in the case.

Their coffees are wonderful, but their baked goods are delicious! So often at cafes back home, they are pretty, but dry. That is Not the case here. We have loved everything we have selected. I also love their sidewalk seating. Their neighhood is pretty as well.

title: Excellent Food
text: I felt,like the food was super fresh and I loved the layers of flavor in each dish. It is so into Indian food, but not the same. The service was attentive by any standards, but especially so for Berlin.

title: Met Expectations
text:
This is a fun place. Kids love it. The story line is fun and engaging. I liked climbing through everything and discovering new outlets to different rooms.

What amazed me to most was how clean everything was. When you see it, you’ll wonder how they keep up with the dust alone!

title: Ok
text: I wanted to be wowed by this place, but I wasn’t. Don’t get me wrong, the food is good, but it isn’t as good as I was lead to believe. Service was good, though. They were quite accommodating.

title: Perfect Location
text: I have to go to DC twice a year for meetings. I fly into Reagan and take the train here. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable. The restaurants inside serve wonderful food. The lobby is spacious in case you need to have impromptu meetings

title: Saved our Trip
text:
We arrived in Budapest after a terrible sleep night on the train. Our bodies and feet were worn out from walking all over Berlin and Prague the days prior, so we found this,place that was on our street.

They were so accommodating since we were just walk-ins on a Sunday. We booked a foot ,assuage and it included leg stretches, headmaster neck, upper body massage as well. We were amazed.

I really liked that we were given clothing to change into for the massage. The tea afterwards finished off the experience perfectly.

title: Wow!
text:
We arrived early from the train and needed coffee. We found our way here and didn’t expect much from this tiny cafe, but boy were we pleasantly surprised.

The coffees were delicious and every pastry or other food item we bought was so fresh. Their portions were also big. The staff was super nice. Definitely recommend this spot.

title: Go at Night
text: We were in Budapest for 3 days. This was my favorite part. We went in around 10pm and left around 2;30am. There wasn’t much of a crowd. The baths were all peaceful. I especially loved loved loved the one on the roof that overlooked the city. Behind you is a mountain that has tunnels through it. In fornt7of you the city and bridges lit up. There was a slight mist of rain that made it even more romantic.

title: Plan an Entire Night
text:
Im not saying this was the best part of my trip, but I did stay here The latest. We went with a group of 6. We came in smaller groups of 2 or 3. You won’t get in in a large group. We dressed sexy. Plan to strip to your level of comfort upon arrival and check your things. You won’t get your phone in either.

We explored the many rooms. Since they are smaller, the sound system is a tad harsh, so bring your ear plugs. The bar lines weren’t too bad even though it was a crowded night.

If you are open to "things" happening, you can find it here, but no one is creepy and no one ever made me feel unsafe.

We went in around 11pm and stayed until 7am, so, needless to say, we had a good time.

title: Fun Place
text:
This was a fun afternoon place. The sound system isn’t awesome, but it was good. The dance area was small and getting a drink took a long time. There are artistic structures you can c;I bet on and explore outside.

We had a fun afternoon dancing and being silly at this place. It was super comfortable for a non-Berliner. It is a quick walk from the bus line.

title: It’s OK with Increible Sound System
text:
I get the hype and perhaps I just wasn’t into the DJs that were there that night, but it’s ok.

Their sound system is exquisite and extremely well balanced. Of course it’s loud, so bring you ear plugs, but you aren’t going to be in pain like you are some other venues.

We attempted to go in twice and we made it in twice. We dress in black all the time anyway, and our style is more mature stylish goth/punk. We know very little English but knew to be ready to show backpacks and belt contents. Just don’t stall the line or they don’t like you.

title: Favorite Restaurant
text: I have visited this restaurant more than any other on my month-long trip. They are accommodating with English menus. The food is amazing offering so many layers of flavor in every dish. No one in our group of 6 friends had anything even mediocre. I recommend the Sochi Olymp.

title: Lovely!
text: Go to this bridge at night if you prefer smaller crowds. During the day there are merchants and artist. The statuary along the bridge are beautiful as is the view.

title: Amazing Food
text:
We loved every dish we ordered. I had the smoked tartare. It was perfectly balanced flavor-wise. My main dish was the pork belly. It simply melted in your mouth.

Their wine selection was reasonably priced. I opted for champagne.

I didn’t care for their industrial decor and seating setup, but I did like seeing everything being prepared.

title: Favorite Hot Spot
text: This is our favorite restaurant in The Marigny. We go here for every special event. We love it because my husband and many of our friends have dietary restrictions that they can accommodate. Just order their "Trust Me" menu item and tell them your restrictions and you will never be disappointed with what arrives. Their bottles of wine are also reasonably priced.

title: Get The Fries!
text: This is one of our favorite haunts in our neighborhood. No matter what you order, you will love it. I always get the falafel sandwich & fries. I can only eat half. They have a vegan version for my husband, so this is a super easy spot for both of us to eat well.

title: Quirky Hotel
text:
Prior to buying our vacation home in New Orleans, we stayed at Villa Convento numerous times. Our room was always clean, the staff always super sweet, and the location was exactly where we wanted to be in the Quarter. We like being on the edge of the Quarter and biking distance to The Marigny/St Roch/Bywater area.

It is slightly run-down, but that adds to the charm. The price has always been great. We typically ask for a balcony room, but have had courtyard rooms as well.

title: Did Not Exceed Expectations
text:
We made a reservation at Maceo for my husband try their vegan options.

The place is beautiful and more old-school fine dining. The Maitre d was expectedly pretentious, which was fine and funny at the same time.

My husband ordered the vegan "caviar" which was lentils with a fig sauce. Not very creative. My friend and I ordered the duck. It was "ok." ....just ok. Our friend also had the foie gras and said it was very good.

They do have a nice wine selection and the sommelier was quite helpful and not snooty.

It was a nice, but it did not wow us. I won't go again, but it was nice to introduce my husband to fine dining since it is so difficult to find vegan options at nice restaurants in Dallas.

title: Amazed!
text:
You have seen photos of the Eiffel Tower your entire life. You cannot imagine the sheer size of this structure until you are standing under it.

The crowds were quite manageable. The lines appeared to be moving at a good, steady rate, although we chose not to go up into the tower. (I will on our next trip)

Be prepared for all the selfie-stick vendors. This is everywhere in Europe. I do have to say that the vendors here were not as aggressive as the ones in Rome.

title: Lovely Accommodations
text:
Most hotel rooms in Europe are small. This was no exception, but the room was very well appointed and the small bathroom was adequate.

Staff was friendly and I actually liked that we had to turn in our key when leaving each time. It was one less thing to worry about.

Easy walk to 2 different train stations and 15 minute walk to Eiffel Tower.

They had a very nice breakfast as well.

title: Beautiful Grounds
text: We attended a garden party at Montmartre. The place was beautiful. We toured the grounds as soon as we arrived. It was simply wonderful to have a wine picnic on the lawn. This was a highlight of our trip.

title: Simple & Well Priced
text: This was the first meal we had when we reached Berlin. I wasn't expecting much, but it was a very pleasant surprise. I had the Vietnamese Bimbimbap. It had depths of flavors with a hint of sweetness that made this the best Vietnamese food I have yet eaten. We went back for our last meal before we left Berlin.

title: EXCELLENT Brunch Selection
text:
I found this restaurant on Happy Cow. I had to call to get a brunch reservation and that was slightly difficult, but it was totally worth the effort.

Viasko is a vegan restaurant that offers an amazing brunch buffet on Saturday and Sunday. We went on a Saturday and my husband was elated that he could participate fully in brunch with me for the very first time. (We don't have many vegan restaurants in Dallas, TX)

The building is really cool and the clientele appeared to be the more creative types....which is our circle of friends back home.

The buffet items were not typical and too many to list. There was not one item on the buffet that was mediocre. Between the two of us, we tried just about all of them.

I highly recommend Viasko's brunch. Make the effort/make the call for the reservation. There is a long line to get in, so be sure you get a seat.

title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE This place
text:
We started our honeymoon in Amsterdam. It was my goal to find fine dining vegan restaurants for my husband as we hit 5 countries. Betty's was listed on Happy Cow, so I made a reservation.

The restaurant is small and intimate. The meal is a fixed price menu of the chef's choosing. I cannot express how delicious every single course was. The server is also the husband of the chef. He was so kind and informative. He explained every dish of every course and the country of origin. The wine he suggested was perfect. The atmosphere was wonderful and the price was fair.

I will definitely visit Betty's again on our next trip to Amsterdam.

title: Not To Be Missed
text:
This place was a sleeper. It was a little difficult to find and it doesn't look like much when you walk in....only has a couple tables, but don't let that fool you. The food was incredible!

If you are vegan, order the vegan plate. I was amazed at how they made vegan food taste like chicken in both flavor and texture.

We liked it to much, we went back before we left Amsterdam.

title: More of a shop than restaurant
text:
This place offers a lot of vegan grocery options. They have a simple vegan restaurant menu that includes wraps and sandwiches. They also offer a few baked goods.

The cupcake I got was delicious. My sandwich was extremely "meh." My husband's take was, "This is what new vegans think vegan eat....except for that cupcake. That was good!"

title: Amazing Visit
text:
When you visit Amsterdam, you must go to Rijksmuseum. We were going to do the Van Gogh museum, but the lines were too long. We were able to get into Rijksmuseum quickly.

There is simply too much to talk about and you won't see it all in a single visit. If you go, pay attention to the architecture. It is as much art as anything displayed in the museum. Add this to your "Must Do List."

title: Mediocre
text:
My husband is vegan. On this trip, my goal was to do fine dining at vegan restaurants.

Il Margutta had a fixed price vegan menu. It sounded wonderful. It was mediocre. I expected more for 50 Euros per person. Most courses needed salt and an acid profile added to them. Any salt at all. My husband's take on our dinner was, "This is what vegetarians think vegans eat."

We made a reservation the night they had an art show in full swing. (we weren't aware until we arrived) The art was wonderful. The music was too loud and all over the place. Voices were loud and carried due to the acoustics of the place. Service was slow.....slower than usual in Europe. I'm ok with taking hours to have several courses, but this was ridiculously slow and un-attentive.

title: AMAZING Food and Excellent Service
text:
I made a reservation weeks before our trip to visit Lucky Leek. The reservation process was super easy.

We arrived a little early for our reservation; the staff was quite accommodating. We had no trouble with the staff understanding English and communicating in English.

We chose the 3 course fixed price dinner with the wine pairing. Our server was informative and knowledgeable. The wine pairings were perfect with each course. Servings we ample. The flavor profile of each dish was exquisite. There was so much going on in each bite. The plating was a spectacular feast for the eyes. Each course was artfully displayed.

My husband has been vegan for 23 years. Watching his face with each bite and each sip of each wine was worth whatever the cost of this evening was. (it was reasonable for the level of dining experienced) He finally understood why I enjoy fine dining.

We will definitely visit Lucky Leek again and do the 5 course menu next time.

title: Quirky & Fun
text:
We visited King's Pub twice on our 4 day trip. The decor is quirky and wonderfully dated. The space around the bar is tight and the staff couldn't be nicer.

We loved listening to the 50's American music blair throughout the pub.

Definitely one of our favorite places on the trip.

title: Worst Tour Ever
text:
AVOID this tour bus like the plague! Disorganized, RUDE, overpacked, windows inside are covered with their logo so you can't see out, no AC. Busses take FOREVER to show.

Amin was the worst as well. He was the guy headed the cattle onto each bus.

We wasted an hour of our time waiting for the next bus that only had seats covered by logos available.
place: I Love Roma Tours - Private Tours
